Consider a parameterized integral `a ↦ ∫ x, f a x` where `f` is continuous and uniformly
compactly supported. Then the integral depends continuously on `a`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_3} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] {α : Type u_6} {β : Type u_7} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α]
  [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace β] [inst_4 : OpensMeasurableSpace β]
  {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure β} [inst_5 : NormedSpace ℝ E] {f : α → β → E} {s : Set α} {k : Set β}
  [inst_6 : MeasureTheory.IsFiniteMeasureOnCompacts μ],
  IsCompact k →
    ContinuousOn (Function.uncurry f) (s ×ˢ Set.univ) →
      (∀ (p : α) (x : β), p ∈ s → x ∉ k → f p x = 0) → ContinuousOn (fun a => ∫ (x : β), f a x ∂μ) s
name: continuousOn_integral_of_compact_support
docString:
Consider a parameterized integral `a ↦ ∫ x, f a x` where `f` is continuous and uniformly
compactly supported. Then the integral depends continuously on `a`.

If a real-valued function `f` is interval integrable and continuous at `a` with strongly measurable derivatives `-f(a)` at `a` for both the left and right limits, then the function `x ↦ ∫(a, x) f(t) dt` has these values as derivatives.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_3} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {f : ℝ → E}
  {a b : ℝ},
  IntervalIntegrable f MeasureTheory.volume a b →
    ∀ {s t : Set ℝ} [inst_3 : intervalIntegral.FTCFilter a (nhdsWithin a s) (nhdsWithin a t)],
      StronglyMeasurableAtFilter f (nhdsWithin a t) MeasureTheory.volume →
        ContinuousWithinAt f t a → HasDerivWithinAt (fun u => ∫ (x : ℝ) in u..b, f x) (-f a) s a
name: intervalIntegral.integral_hasDerivWithinAt_left
docString: If a real-valued function `f` is interval integrable and continuous at `a` with strongly measurable derivatives `-f(a)` at `a` for both the left and right limits, then the function `x ↦ ∫(a, x) f(t) dt` has these values as derivatives.

The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus-1 states that if a function `f : ℝ → E` is interval integrable on `a..b` (that is, it is integrable on both intervals `(a, b]` and `(b, a]`) and is continuous at `a`, then the function defined by `u ↦ ∫ x in u..b, f x` has a derivative at `a` which is `-f a`. Here, `E` is a normed additively commutative group which is also a normed space over the real numbers and is complete. The function `f` is strongly measurable at a neighborhood filter of `a` with respect to the Lebesgue measure.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_3} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {f : ℝ → E}
  {a b : ℝ},
  IntervalIntegrable f MeasureTheory.volume a b →
    StronglyMeasurableAtFilter f (nhds a) MeasureTheory.volume →
      ContinuousAt f a → HasDerivAt (fun u => ∫ (x : ℝ) in u..b, f x) (-f a) a
name: intervalIntegral.integral_hasDerivAt_left
docString: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus-1 states that if a function `f : ℝ → E` is interval integrable on `a..b` (that is, it is integrable on both intervals `(a, b]` and `(b, a]`) and is continuous at `a`, then the function defined by `u ↦ ∫ x in u..b, f x` has a derivative at `a` which is `-f a`. Here, `E` is a normed additively commutative group which is also a normed space over the real numbers and is complete. The function `f` is strongly measurable at a neighborhood filter of `a` with respect to the Lebesgue measure.

If a function is locally integrable, then it is integrable on any compact set.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {E : Type u_3} [inst : MeasurableSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  {f : X → E} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure X} {k : Set X},
  MeasureTheory.LocallyIntegrable f → IsCompact k → MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn f k
name: MeasureTheory.LocallyIntegrable.integrableOn_isCompact
docString: If a function is locally integrable, then it is integrable on any compact set.

For any locally finite measure μ on the real numbers and any constant function f(x) = c, the function is integrable with respect to μ on any interval [a, b].

type:
∀ {E : Type u_3} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] {a b : ℝ} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure ℝ}
  [inst_1 : MeasureTheory.IsLocallyFiniteMeasure μ] {c : E}, IntervalIntegrable (fun x => c) μ a b
name: intervalIntegrable_const
docString: For any locally finite measure μ on the real numbers and any constant function f(x) = c, the function is integrable with respect to μ on any interval [a, b].

This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, any type `E` that forms a normed additive commutative group, any constant function `a : E`, and any functions `c : Fin n → ℂ` and `R : Fin n → ℝ`, the constant function is integrable on the generalized torus. In other words, the integrability of the composition of the constant function and a torus map (defined by `c` and `R`) over the interval from 0 to \(2\pi\) (for all components) is guaranteed.

type:
∀ {n : ℕ} {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] (a : E) (c : Fin n → ℂ) (R : Fin n → ℝ),
  TorusIntegrable (fun x => a) c R
name: TorusIntegrable.torusIntegrable_const
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, any type `E` that forms a normed additive commutative group, any constant function `a : E`, and any functions `c : Fin n → ℂ` and `R : Fin n → ℝ`, the constant function is integrable on the generalized torus. In other words, the integrability of the composition of the constant function and a torus map (defined by `c` and `R`) over the interval from 0 to \(2\pi\) (for all components) is guaranteed.

Integral of a simple function whose codomain is `ℝ≥0∞`.

type: {α : Type u_1} → {_m : MeasurableSpace α} → MeasureTheory.SimpleFunc α ENNReal → MeasureTheory.Measure α → ENNReal
name: MeasureTheory.SimpleFunc.lintegral
docString: Integral of a simple function whose codomain is `ℝ≥0∞`.

Integral of a simple function `α →ₛ ℝ≥0∞` as a bilinear map.

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {m : MeasurableSpace α} → MeasureTheory.SimpleFunc α ENNReal →ₗ[ENNReal] MeasureTheory.Measure α →ₗ[ENNReal] ENNReal
name: MeasureTheory.SimpleFunc.lintegralₗ
docString: Integral of a simple function `α →ₛ ℝ≥0∞` as a bilinear map.

A holomorphic function on a compact connected complex manifold is constant.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] {F : Type u_2} [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F]
  [inst_3 : NormedSpace ℂ F] {H : Type u_3} [inst_4 : TopologicalSpace H] {I : ModelWithCorners ℂ E H}
  [inst_5 : ModelWithCorners.Boundaryless I] {M : Type u_4} [inst_6 : TopologicalSpace M] [inst_7 : CompactSpace M]
  [inst_8 : ChartedSpace H M] [inst_9 : SmoothManifoldWithCorners I M] [inst_10 : PreconnectedSpace M] {f : M → F},
  MDifferentiable I (modelWithCornersSelf ℂ F) f → ∀ (a b : M), f a = f b
name: MDifferentiable.apply_eq_of_compactSpace
docString: A holomorphic function on a compact connected complex manifold is constant.

The Fourier integral of an `L^1` function is a continuous function.

type:
∀ {𝕜 : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing 𝕜] {V : Type u_2} [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module 𝕜 V]
  [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace V] {W : Type u_3} [inst_4 : AddCommGroup W] [inst_5 : Module 𝕜 W] {E : Type u_4}
  [inst_6 : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_7 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_8 : TopologicalSpace 𝕜] [inst_9 : TopologicalRing 𝕜]
  [inst_10 : TopologicalSpace V] [inst_11 : BorelSpace V] [inst_12 : TopologicalSpace W]
  {e : Multiplicative 𝕜 →* ↥circle} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure V} {L : V →ₗ[𝕜] W →ₗ[𝕜] 𝕜}
  [inst_13 : FirstCountableTopology W],
  Continuous ⇑e →
    (Continuous fun p => (L p.1) p.2) →
      ∀ {f : V → E}, MeasureTheory.Integrable f → Continuous (VectorFourier.fourierIntegral e μ L f)
name: VectorFourier.fourierIntegral_continuous
docString: The Fourier integral of an `L^1` function is a continuous function.

A holomorphic function on a compact complex manifold is locally constant.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] {F : Type u_2} [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F]
  [inst_3 : NormedSpace ℂ F] {H : Type u_3} [inst_4 : TopologicalSpace H] {I : ModelWithCorners ℂ E H}
  [inst_5 : ModelWithCorners.Boundaryless I] {M : Type u_4} [inst_6 : TopologicalSpace M] [inst_7 : CompactSpace M]
  [inst_8 : ChartedSpace H M] [inst_9 : SmoothManifoldWithCorners I M] {f : M → F},
  MDifferentiable I (modelWithCornersSelf ℂ F) f → IsLocallyConstant f
name: MDifferentiable.isLocallyConstant
docString: A holomorphic function on a compact complex manifold is locally constant.

The Cauchy formula for the derivative of a holomorphic function.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {U : Set ℂ},
  IsOpen U →
    ∀ {c w₀ : ℂ} {R : ℝ} {f : ℂ → E},
      Metric.closedBall c R ⊆ U →
        DifferentiableOn ℂ f U →
          w₀ ∈ Metric.ball c R →
            ((2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I)⁻¹ • ∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), ((z - w₀) ^ 2)⁻¹ • f z) = deriv f w₀
name: Complex.two_pi_I_inv_smul_circleIntegral_sub_sq_inv_smul_of_differentiable
docString: The Cauchy formula for the derivative of a holomorphic function.

A constant function is uniformly integrable.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} {ι : Type u_3} {m : MeasurableSpace α} (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α)
  [inst : NormedAddCommGroup β] {p : ENNReal} {g : α → β},
  1 ≤ p → p ≠ ⊤ → MeasureTheory.Memℒp g p → MeasureTheory.UnifIntegrable (fun x => g) p μ
name: MeasureTheory.unifIntegrable_const
docString: A constant function is uniformly integrable.

The integral of a continuous function is differentiable on a real set `s`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_3} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {f : ℝ → E} {a : ℝ}
  {s : Set ℝ},
  (∀ x ∈ s, IntervalIntegrable f MeasureTheory.volume a x) →
    Continuous f → DifferentiableOn ℝ (fun u => ∫ (x : ℝ) in a..u, f x) s
name: intervalIntegral.differentiableOn_integral_of_continuous
docString: The integral of a continuous function is differentiable on a real set `s`.

Any integrable function can be approximated by bounded continuous functions,
version in terms of `∫`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_2 : T4Space α] [inst_3 : BorelSpace α]
  {E : Type u_2} [inst_4 : NormedAddCommGroup E] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} [inst_5 : NormedSpace ℝ E]
  [inst_6 : MeasureTheory.Measure.WeaklyRegular μ] {f : α → E},
  MeasureTheory.Integrable f → ∀ {ε : ℝ}, 0 < ε → ∃ g, ∫ (x : α), ‖f x - g x‖ ∂μ ≤ ε ∧ MeasureTheory.Integrable ⇑g
name: MeasureTheory.Integrable.exists_boundedContinuous_integral_sub_le
docString:
Any integrable function can be approximated by bounded continuous functions,
version in terms of `∫`.

A single function is uniformly integrable.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} {ι : Type u_3} {m : MeasurableSpace α} (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α)
  [inst : NormedAddCommGroup β] {p : ENNReal} [inst_1 : Subsingleton ι],
  1 ≤ p → p ≠ ⊤ → ∀ {f : ι → α → β}, (∀ (i : ι), MeasureTheory.Memℒp (f i) p) → MeasureTheory.UnifIntegrable f p μ
name: MeasureTheory.unifIntegrable_subsingleton
docString: A single function is uniformly integrable.

A continuous function with compact support is integrable on the whole space.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {E : Type u_3} [inst : MeasurableSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  {f : X → E} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure X} [inst_3 : OpensMeasurableSpace X]
  [inst_4 : MeasureTheory.IsFiniteMeasureOnCompacts μ], Continuous f → HasCompactSupport f → MeasureTheory.Integrable f
name: Continuous.integrable_of_hasCompactSupport
docString: A continuous function with compact support is integrable on the whole space.

Integral of `|x - a| ^ n` over `Ι a b`. This integral appears in the proof of the
Picard-Lindelöf/Cauchy-Lipschitz theorem.

name: integral_pow_abs_sub_uIoc
docString:
Integral of `|x - a| ^ n` over `Ι a b`. This integral appears in the proof of the
Picard-Lindelöf/Cauchy-Lipschitz theorem.

Any integrable function can be approximated by bounded continuous functions,
version in terms of `∫⁻`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_2 : T4Space α] [inst_3 : BorelSpace α]
  {E : Type u_2} [inst_4 : NormedAddCommGroup E] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} [inst_5 : NormedSpace ℝ E]
  [inst_6 : MeasureTheory.Measure.WeaklyRegular μ] {f : α → E},
  MeasureTheory.Integrable f →
    ∀ {ε : ENNReal}, ε ≠ 0 → ∃ g, ∫⁻ (x : α), ↑‖f x - g x‖₊ ∂μ ≤ ε ∧ MeasureTheory.Integrable ⇑g
name: MeasureTheory.Integrable.exists_boundedContinuous_lintegral_sub_le
docString:
Any integrable function can be approximated by bounded continuous functions,
version in terms of `∫⁻`.

If a function is integrable, then the integral of its truncated versions converges to the
integral of the whole function.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {m : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {f : α → ℝ},
  MeasureTheory.Integrable f →
    Filter.Tendsto (fun A => ∫ (x : α), ProbabilityTheory.truncation f A x ∂μ) Filter.atTop (nhds (∫ (x : α), f x ∂μ))
name: ProbabilityTheory.tendsto_integral_truncation
docString:
If a function is integrable, then the integral of its truncated versions converges to the
integral of the whole function.

A continuous function `f` is locally integrable with respect to any locally finite measure.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {E : Type u_3} [inst : MeasurableSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  {f : X → E} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure X} [inst_3 : OpensMeasurableSpace X]
  [inst_4 : MeasureTheory.IsLocallyFiniteMeasure μ] [inst_5 : SecondCountableTopologyEither X E],
  Continuous f → MeasureTheory.LocallyIntegrable f
name: Continuous.locallyIntegrable
docString: A continuous function `f` is locally integrable with respect to any locally finite measure.

If `f` is a locally integrable real-valued function on `Ioi 0` which is `O(x ^ (-a))` at `∞`
and `O(x ^ (-b))` at `0`, then its Mellin transform integral converges for `b < s < a`.

type:
∀ {a b : ℝ} {f : ℝ → ℝ} {s : ℝ},
  MeasureTheory.LocallyIntegrableOn f (Set.Ioi 0) →
    (f =O[Filter.atTop] fun x => x ^ (-a)) →
      s < a →
        (f =O[nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0)] fun x => x ^ (-b)) →
          b < s → MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (fun t => t ^ (s - 1) * f t) (Set.Ioi 0)
name: mellin_convergent_of_isBigO_scalar
docString:
If `f` is a locally integrable real-valued function on `Ioi 0` which is `O(x ^ (-a))` at `∞`
and `O(x ^ (-b))` at `0`, then its Mellin transform integral converges for `b < s < a`.

A holomorphic function on a compact connected complex manifold is the constant function `f ≡ v`,
for some value `v`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] {F : Type u_2} [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F]
  [inst_3 : NormedSpace ℂ F] {H : Type u_3} [inst_4 : TopologicalSpace H] {I : ModelWithCorners ℂ E H}
  [inst_5 : ModelWithCorners.Boundaryless I] {M : Type u_4} [inst_6 : TopologicalSpace M] [inst_7 : CompactSpace M]
  [inst_8 : ChartedSpace H M] [inst_9 : SmoothManifoldWithCorners I M] [inst_10 : PreconnectedSpace M] {f : M → F},
  MDifferentiable I (modelWithCornersSelf ℂ F) f → ∃ v, f = Function.const M v
name: MDifferentiable.exists_eq_const_of_compactSpace
docString:
A holomorphic function on a compact connected complex manifold is the constant function `f ≡ v`,
for some value `v`.

The integral closure of R in an R-algebra A.

type: (R : Type u_1) → (A : Type u_2) → [inst : CommRing R] → [inst_1 : CommRing A] → [inst_2 : Algebra R A] → Subalgebra R A
name: integralClosure
docString: The integral closure of R in an R-algebra A.
